Math.RandomGenerator class

　Math.RandomGenerator is a class for generating random numbers by the Mersenne Twister method.

　The syntax of the constructor is as follows.
new Math.RandomGenerator([<Random seed>]);

　Specifying a number in the constructor initializes the random number generator with that number.
　If you specify a dictionary array object that saves its state with the serialize method in the constructor, you can create a random number generator in that state.
　If the constructor is omitted, the random number generator is initialized with a random value based on the current time. (In the case of Kirikiri 2, it is initialized with a random number from the random number generator based on environmental noise instead of the current time. ).

randomize

　The randomize method initializes a random number generator. The arguments are the same as those specified in the constructor.

random

　The random method returns a real random value between 0 and 1.0.

random32

　The random32 method returns an integer random value between 0 and 4,294,967,295 or less (0xffffffff or less).

random63

　The random63 method returns an integer random value between 0 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 (0x7fffffffffffffffff or less).

random64

　The random64 method returns an integer random value between -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.

serialize

　The serialize method returns a dictionary array object that records the current state. This dictionary array object can be reproduced again by passing it to the constructor and randomize method.

Copyright notice

　To implement the Mersenne Twister method

A C-program for MT19937, with initialization improved 2002/2/10. Coded by Takuji Nishimura and Makoto Matsumoto.

　The modified version is used. Thanks to both for releasing useful program sources.
